author: Cast Iron Keto
title: Keto Jalapeño Popper Casserole with Chicken
ingredients: 1 ½ pounds cooked shredded chicken breast
5 jalapeno peppers (halved (ribs removed if you like less spice)
instructions_list: Place the chicken in the bottom of a 10” or larger cast iron skillet. Top with green onions.
Combine the garlic salt, onion powder, paprika, cream cheese, heavy cream, and chicken bone broth in a small bowl. Mix until combined.
Pour the cream cheese mixture over the chicken then top with the slices of jalapeno. Sprinkle the cheddar cheese over the top then top with the crumbled bacon.
Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 15 minutes until the cheese is bubbly. Serve immediately.
description: Keto Jalapeño Popper Casserole with Chicken: A deliciously creamy and spicy low-carb dish with shredded chicken, cream cheese, jalapenos, and bacon.

questions.question: Do jalapenos have carbs?
questions.answer: Yes, jalapenos contain low carbohydrates, with about 1 gram of net carbs in a medium-sized pepper. The majority of their carbs come from dietary fiber. Moderately including jalapenos in a keto or low-carb diet won't greatly affect carb intake.

questions.question: Can I adjust the spiciness of the casserole?
questions.answer: Yes, you can adjust the spiciness of the casserole to your liking. Remove jalapeno seeds and membranes for milder heat, or add more jalapenos for extra spiciness.

questions.question: Can I add other vegetables to the casserole?
questions.answer: Absolutely! You can customize the recipe for flavor and nutrition by adding vegetables like diced bell peppers, spinach, or mushrooms.

questions.question: Can I store the leftovers?
questions.answer: Yes! Leftovers can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3-4 days. Reheat individual portions in the microwave or oven.

questions.question: Can I make this casserole ahead of time?
questions.answer: Yes, you can prepare the casserole ahead of time and refrigerate it. When ready to serve, reheat it in the oven until warmed.

questions.question: Can I use substitutes for cream cheese in the casserole?
questions.answer: Yes, you can use alternative options like Greek yogurt, sour cream, or a dairy-free cream cheese substitute to suit your dietary needs or preferences.

questions.question: Are jalapenos hotter than bell peppers?
questions.answer: Yes, jalapenos are hotter than bell peppers. Jalapenos fall into the medium heat range, while bell peppers are mild.
